skill.name: labarchive-integration
skill.description: Electronic lab notebook API integration. Access notebooks, manage entries/attachments, backup notebooks, integrate with Protocols.io/Jupyter/REDCap, for programmatic ELN workflows.
skill.summary: Electronic lab notebook API integration. Access notebooks, manage entries/attachments, backup notebo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential harvesting or exfiltration patterns were detected. Network usage is limited to LabArchives API calls that match the documented purpose. Local credential storage uses a permissions-restricted config file.

content.value_statement: Manual notebook updates slow research workflows. This skill provides scripts and references to authenticate, manage entries, and back up LabArchives data.
actual_capabilities: Create a secure config.yaml with regional API endpoints and credentials
List accessible notebooks for a user and show roles
Back up notebooks to 7z, XML, or JSON files
Create entries with titles, content, and optional dates
Upload single or batch attachments to entries
limitations: Requires Enterprise LabArchives API access and valid credentials
Depends on the labarchives-py client for live API calls
Backups and uploads operate on local filesystem paths
Only covers endpoints implemented in the provided scripts

use_cases.title: Backup lab notebooks
use_cases.description: Schedule backups of all team notebooks for compliance and retention.

use_cases.title: Upload analysis outputs
use_cases.description: Attach result files and summaries to the correct LabArchives entries.

use_cases.title: Integrate institutional tools
use_cases.description: Connect LabArchives with Jupyter or REDCap workflows using the API guides.

prompt_templates.title: Set up config
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through creating config.yaml for the LabArchives API and selecting the correct regional endpoint.

prompt_templates.title: List notebooks
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to list all notebooks for a user and interpret the roles.

prompt_templates.title: Backup notebook
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a command to back up notebook 12345 with attachments and save to a backups folder.

prompt_templates.title: Batch upload files
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a workflow to upload all files from a directory to an existing entry and report success.

output_examples.input: Back up notebook 12345 without attachments in JSON format.
output: Output file will be saved under backups with a timestamp
Data will be JSON without attachments
Errors will be reported with HTTP status and response snippet

best_practices: Store credentials only in config.yaml with 600 permissions
Use the correct regional API endpoint for your institution
Verify backup files after export and keep timestamps
anti_patterns: Embedding credentials directly in scripts or prompts
Uploading large files without checking size limits
Running backups without confirming notebook access

faq.question: Is this compatible with all LabArchives accounts?
faq.answer: It requires an Enterprise LabArchives license with API access enabled.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It only supports operations implemented in the scripts and documented endpoints.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Jupyter or REDCap?
faq.answer: Yes, the references include integration guidance and API workflows.

faq.question: How is my data kept safe?
faq.answer: Credentials are stored locally in config.yaml with restrictive file permissions.

faq.question: What should I do if authentication fails?
faq.answer: Verify access key, external applications password, and API access settings.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual use?
faq.answer: It automates repeatable tasks like backups and entry uploads through scripts.
